channel.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
channel.description: well i logged into moddb just only to see that NEOTOKYO has a release date and that it is in two days! just felt like sharing that and have fun discussing [quote] NEOTOKYO° will be releasing in two stages: Server files in the evening on July 2nd, and the Client files on July 3rd. [/quote] found that [url='https://www.moddb.com/mods/neotokyo/news/nt-release-date-announced-details']HERE[/url]

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
Yomomasface:

This Mod owns you up the buttox. Nuff said. Ok, more. It’s pretty fun for a few hours… days… umm, endless fun. I’m just tired of the frekkin ONE game mode in it. Ghost. I want a Team Dethmatch or something! I hate it when i die and I’m waiting half a frekkin hour to rejoin. It’s frustrating. Even worse then Counter-Strike: Source. They better make an Update with a Deathmatch type game. Still, no way I’m going to play Neotokyo more than Black Mesa when it comes out though!! XD

Oh my, this post made me wish I didn’t look in this thread again

Read full topic

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: Teh_Casino
item.description:
Imonfire:

That’s because you play it like CS. If you pulled your head out of your ass just a bit you’d see there’s an objective to do. Not just kill the other team. You’d also see you can make yourself invisible, lean on walls, use ironsights, use the ghost to see where the other team is, use thermo-vision to see stealth, chose your class and model, play with your team (and not go Rambo), use your mic when you ghost, flank, use stealth intelligently (not in a bright room or straight surface ) and much more.

Just so you know, I did do all those things. I just don’t like the mod. The servers I went on, hardly anyone actually went for the ghost, pretty much everyone was playing it like CS. I also feel like almost all the maps are a bitch to navigate.

After playing a few more hours, I realize its not a clone of CS. But honestly, I haven’t had this little fun playing a mod since Insurgency.

Read full topic

That’s because you play it like CS. If you pulled your head out of your ass just a bit you’d see there’s an objective to do. Not just kill the other team. You’d also see you can make yourself invisible, lean on walls, use ironsights, use the ghost to see where the other team is, use thermo-vision to see stealth, chose your class and model, play with your team (and not go Rambo), use your mic when you ghost, flank, use stealth intelligently (not in a bright room or straight surface ) and much more.

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: FlotsamX
item.description:
I have to say, for a mod that has been in production for FOUR YEARS, the gameplay feels like a blantant ripoff of CS, and it doesn’t even manage to pull that off well. In addition, it feels at times like the developers put all their bravado and energy in their flashier maps, and don’t even care that there are still sterile bleak looking abandoned cities with nothing but dim cars to remove the repetition of the roads. For a mod that received so much hype, I’m thoroughly disappointed.

Read full topic

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
You guys will get bored with it eventually, then you will see.

Oh, so cocksure. When were you credited to predict the future? How the fuck do you know?

Perhaps someone could insightfully explain why its so great, because It just seems too lackluster to me.

Troll harder, pal.

Read full topic

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: Teh_Casino
item.description:
You guys will get bored with it eventually, then you will realize.

Perhaps someone could insightfully explain why its so great, because It just seems too lackluster to me. My reasoning is that capture the flag type gameplay just doesn’t work when you combine it with round based gameplay. The only that keeps it from being a clone of CS, is the classes.

OldDirtyBastard:

Straight person would post above quoted in the first place.

I have no idea what you are saying.

Read full topic

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Fine, due to popular demand, I will take back what I said about NeoTokyo being similar to Counter-Strike.

Not that there was an actual demand. We just said that your arguments were invalid because they made no sense.

But it still not fun to play. You can’t even tell who is on your team sometimes. Not to say that it’s not well done for a mod, but it just does not fit my tastes, and I’m sure some others would agree as well.

Stop trying to find a lame excuse for your trolling. Straight person would post above quoted in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
Teh_Casino:

Seriously though, two teams start at separate ends of the map, choose guns and kill each other, then everyone respawns at the start of the next round.

How is that not similar to Counter-Strike?

You do realise that that description is pretty much sound for any MP FSP made in the past 15 years, right…?

Read full topic

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: Kajshgfka
item.description:
Imonfire:

I hate the recon class. Actually I hate being against the Recon Class. It’s so coward. All you have to do is to take a gun that doesn’t have “Muzzel - Flash” (I don’t know what’s the word, but it means there’s fire comin’ out of the barrel), make yourself invisible and sit in a dark corner. Then voilà, everybody’s dead.

Fix’d

Read full topic

item.title: NEOTOKYO Release Date
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Shit. Why is it so resource hungry?
It outpasses the freakin TF2, which I can play 1024x728 all max without AA and AF…
Jesus F. Christ, every time some punk leaps out of the corner, the game lags. Every time I turn 180 degrees, the game FUCKING LAGS.
What the Hell. it’s supposed to be source, right?
Anyway, game is incredibly good looking.

EDIT: Early version of manual - https://www.moddb.com/mods/neotokyo/downloads/official-neotokyo-manual

Read full topic
